1122627336149643264.text: This salt flat in #Bolivia holds vast quantities of lithium, but bringing it to market poses challenges. https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/images/144976/lithium-harvesting-at-salar-de-uyuni … #NASA #Landsatpic.twitter.com/4kD3IfnOog

1123335010122072064.text: The jewel-toned lakes of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau look spectacular from space. Due to differences in depth, sediments, and microscopic organisms, they  present as a myriad of greens, blues, and teals when viewed from above. https://go.nasa.gov/2UMj4Cl  https://go.nasa.gov/2vvDmG8  #NASApic.twitter.com/YJCPKlASsM

1121492324201029632.text: The melting of Antarctica's ice sheet is responsible for 20-25% of global sea level rise. Scientists at @NASAJPL are working to make scientific modeling more precise to better understand what's happening and what it could look like in the coming centuries.https://go.nasa.gov/2ZyanyW

1122862615397588992.text: Do you prefer the toasty warm  tropical regions? Does your personality sparkle ? Do you love springtime ? So do phytoplankton! This @NASAOcean quiz can help identify which plankton shares your individual traits: http://bit.ly/2UIqOpL pic.twitter.com/M6EGRYjKLm

1122938482589077505.text: On this day in 2003, the SeaWiFS  acquired this image of a massive low pressure system churning off the California coast.  https://go.nasa.gov/2UOVZPt  https://go.nasa.gov/2PJVeX7  #NASAEarth20 #EarthDayEveryDay #OTDpic.twitter.com/NRLyf9hZHb

1122933619075502081.text: None of this would be possible without the many scientists, engineers, data hounds, patrons, and friends who review our work, tip us off to stories, and share their insights. Thank you.  https://go.nasa.gov/2ZNiurR  #NASAEO20 #EarthDayEveryDaypic.twitter.com/YrLEfB3Gqv

1122862618614669313.text: Plankton play an important role in Earth's  climate, sequestering carbon from the atmosphere in the ocean. In large blooms, plankton are visible from space, painting  the ocean  with swirling colors. Take a closer look at plankton personalities  https://twitter.com/i/moments/1108193419757789184 …

1122933600956104704.text: At the end of the 20th century, all EO readers arrived via computer, mostly desktops.  One third connected via dial-up modem. Today, about 40 percent of them arrive on mobile phones and tablets. #NASAEO20 #EarthDayEveryDaypic.twitter.com/uv8DnA6rIa

1122335095539499008.text: These false-color images show a glacial lake in the Himalayas nearly doubling in length over 30 years. https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/images/144864/as-a-himalayan-glacier-melts-a-lake-grows …pic.twitter.com/KKdD1ulHWK

1122933615745277953.text: The site has had five different designs over the decades. https://go.nasa.gov/2ZIzq2v  #NASAEO20 #EarthDayEveryDaypic.twitter.com/ulxPRGRk1k

1122933610275799043.text: When the site launched, images from  science satellites were generally available about a month after acquisition. Two decades later, many  observations are available freely on the web within hours.   #NASAEO20 #EarthDayEveryDaypic.twitter.com/MZ9RqXHWHR

1122953700245409792.text: From its perch on the International @Space_Station, OCO-3 measurements  will help scientists unscramble which sources of carbon dioxide are in nature and which are caused by humans. Learn more about OCO-3 and its new home on the space station:https://go.nasa.gov/2IQukw6

1122933613518118912.text: Since launch, the site has published more than 6,900 Images of the Day, 8,300 natural hazards images, and 450 features and videos. https://go.nasa.gov/2ZIzq2v#NASAEO20 … #EarthDayEveryDaypic.twitter.com/YB4ur0LI3o

1121531208750465024.text: Sometimes the slow grind of plate tectonics determines where and when lakes exist. https://go.nasa.gov/2XLLpub pic.twitter.com/9fgJZe5TCD

1123275113984663552.text: Published on this day in 2014, ocean currents and nutrient-rich waters conspired to create a boon for some ocean species and a dead zone for others just off the coast of #Namibia. https://go.nasa.gov/2UOVZPt  https://go.nasa.gov/2V7n5WM  #NASAEO20 #EarthDayEveryDay #phytoplankton #sulfurpic.twitter.com/Cp6gyeBi4Q
